div.l: To go to mylle ⁊and sen her corn ygroundeA 4008
And hardely þei durste ley here nek
Þᵉ myller shulde not stele hym self a pek4010
Of corn ne by sleyth ne bi force hem reue
And at at þᵉ laste þis wardeyn ȝaf hem leue
Iohn heyth þᵗat oon ⁊and Aleyn heyth þᵗat oþ̉er
Of oo toune were þey born þᵗat heyth strother
Fer in þᵉ north I con not telle where4015
Þis Aleyn maketh al redy his gere
And on an hors þᵉ sak casteth a non
Forth goth Aleyn ⁊and forth goth Iohn
Wᵗith gode swerd ⁊and bokeler by her syde
Iohn knew þᵉ wey hym nedeth no gyde4020
And at þᵉ mylle þᵉ sak a doun he leyth
Aleyn spak fyrst al heyle symond he seith
How fareth þi fayre douht̉er ⁊and þi wyf
Aleyn welcome qduod symkyn by my lif
And Iohn also how now what do ȝe here4025
By god qduod Iohn symond for nede haþ no pere
Hym bihoueth to s̉erue hym self þᵗat hath no swayn
Or elles is he a fole as clerkes seyn
Oure maunciple I hope he wll be ded
So wyrkes ay þᵉ wanges in his hed4030
And þ̉erfore am I come ⁊and eke Aleyn
To grynde oure corn ⁊and carie hit home ageyn
I pᵃray ȝow spede vs henne as tyte as ȝe may
Hit shall be don qduod symkyn by my fay
What wyll ȝe don while hit is in hand4035
By god by þᵉ hopᵉer wyll I stnd
Qduod Ioh se how þᵉ n goth Inne
